intro: Oxystophyllum floridanum, commonly known as the Florida oxystophyllum, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. It has a short stature, often reaching only a few inches in height, and is known for its unique ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it faces significant conservation challenges.
